meanings.definition: The action of flowing in; inflow.
meanings.sent1: The influxes of water into the river were strong after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The city experienced an influx of tourists during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The influxes of students into the classroom made the teacher smile.
meanings.sent4: The influxes of ideas into her mind sparked creativity.
meanings.sent5: The influxes of happiness into her heart were overwhelming.

meanings.sent1: The sudden influxes of customers caught the store off guard.
meanings.sent2: The influxes of emails flooded her inbox every morning.
meanings.sent3: The influxes of birds into the garden created a chirpy atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The influxes of memories into his mind brought nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The influxes of energy into the room lifted everyone's spirits.
